Reviews.Title: “One word - horrible!”
Reviews.Author: TG0871
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Elite World because of the convenient location in Taksim but other that a good location, this hotel is terrible. Rooms are very dirty: carpet full of stains, shower cubical full of mold, low water pressure makes it very hard to take a decent shower but the worst was the trash from previous get was still in the bin, including used a condom!! Minibar not refilled, of course the consumption of previous guest was on my bill! AC in the room not working made it almost impossible to sleep. I complaint three times without any result. Telephones not working had to go down to Reception to order Room Service. Room service order was delivered incorrectly. Breakfast is very poor as well. Selection and quality below average, coffee & tea served out of urns, if you want to have fresh coffee you need to pay extra. Table linen very dirty and seems not to get changed at all. Overall recommendation for this hotel - STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Neat,clean,place with luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nasser75
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant 6 nights stay in elite world .the hotel is located in a quite pedestrian street that is about 300meters from taksim square.The rooms were clean and luxurious,the staff was very helpfull and informative (special thanks to Cerpil the guest relation desk employee).

Reviews.Title: “just locatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: amandre k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights,the eighth(8).floor.The toilets were not clean, and they never knew how to clean them well while our stay.the cleanÄ±ng was very poor. covered by dirty sheets. Also in the main bed were black hears. locatÄ±on was ok.

Reviews.Title: “maybe wÄ±ll come”
Reviews.Author: haasan j
Reviews.Content: Ä± stayed two nÄ±ght the tenth floor.the cleanÄ±ng of the room always half,eÄ±ther leavÄ±ng no towels and no change sheets on the bed.and room smelt smokÄ±ng.but just spa area was good.staff frÄ±endly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kees_dolkens
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this wonderful hotel. We had a beautiful, comfortable and very clean room on the 7th floor. Breakfast was perfect. The biggest compliment is for the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: arezou_56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good location in the city specially for shopping and walking around ,also it is near to sea and piers . We spent 3 nights in one of delux rooms and although it was a bit small but very comfortable and very clean and the bed was so nice and convinient. It was january and very cold outside but the air conditioning system was very good . We enjoyed making tea and coffee in room .The other positive point is the free high speed internet in rooms and lobby . The room service staff were very quick and efficient specially in fixing technical problems in room . All the staff were very friendly and helpfull . At the end we enjoyed the good view of the city from 10th floor. I definitly come back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Nasser S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. It's close to Taksim Square. The staff are very friendly. I did not find a don't disturb sign on the door, therefore, I sometime get disturbed by room servisr staff. I really had a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Be careful maybe there is a frode!”
Reviews.Author: Lsofiam L
Reviews.Content: There is no one Elite World Hotel but two, side by side. The one, in the corner, is this of 5 star quality, the other next to this is hardly a 4 star hotel. For bad luck i stayed to this of 4 stars. Nobody was speaking English, bad food for breakfast and on the top of all, somebody from the staff that was cleaning the rooms has stollen one of my new pair of athetic shoes. From the hotel nobody told me politly: "we are sorry for what happenned to you". They seemed to be used in such situations. I didn't recomend this hotel even to my enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Islandmomma58
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed hotel. The room I had was rather small, the bed was very hard and the pillows too soft (not my preference). Terrific location, close to Taskim Square and surrounded by restaurants and small shops. The biggest complaint was the temperature of the room; it was too hot and difficult to control the heat. I prefer a room in which the windows can be opened.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Sana E
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. The location was right next to Taksim Square, we were able to walk around easily. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not very recommended”
Reviews.Author: Yonation
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is great, the cleanness is super, and safety is present.. but what made my stay at this hotel unbearable are the following: 1) Climate : we went on November the weather was little bit cold so the hotel decided to shut down the A/C, the rooms are steamy hot all day and you can't open the windows so I tried to minimize my stay at the room as much as possible put into consideration that I have a toddler, an other option was keeping the room door open which was inconvenient since you won't have your privacy. 2) Noise : our room was on the 10th floor yet I keep hearing loud music from a night club near by every night starting at 9PM till after midnight and I'm a light sleeper so I didn't have a good sleep through out my stay specially that the mattresses were rock hard while I like having a comfy mattress and they didn't offer other mattress options. adding to that : on the last night I spent on that hotel there were some inconsiderate guests who had their children screaming and shouting up till midnight slamming doors and making any kind of disturbing noise you can imagine ! I called the room guest and the front desk but no use I had to wait for the children to sleep at around 12:30am so that I could finally get myself a decent couple of hours of sleep before my flight ! I was just worried that the noise would wake up my child who was fast asleep at 8:30pm so if you can handle the heat, noise, sleepless nights then this is the hotel for you !! will I visit Istanbul again ? certainly ! will I ever consider staying at this hotel ? Never in a million years !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: kabramayank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Elite World for 4 nights and we would recommend it to anyone looking for a â€˜valueâ€™ stay. The hotel is not the jazziest in the world but serves the purpose that a 5-star is supposed to. The location is very good being just off Taksim square and Istiklal Street which are in walking distance. There are loads of restaurants and pubs around for late night meals. Unlike some of the streets close-by, this one never got dark or dull as there are shops and other places near by. One added advantage is that the bus service (hawas) has its Taksim point very close to the hotel so you can travel from both the old or the new airports to this place easily without a cab. Bosphorous and Sultanahmet areas are close by 10-15 mins by cab. The service at the hotel was top notch. Right from the reception to the restaurant, the people there tried to make you feel most welcome and at home. Being our first visit, we had loads of questions and the people at the reception always had time to answer them. Would specially like to thank one gentleman 'Murat D' who was at the reception and took additional care to make us feel at home. The view from the hotel is something that is not the greatest given tall buildings around so that was a negative. The rooms are nice and clean. We were originally allotted a room that happened to be a corner room on 10th floor but was probably the smallest room at the hotel. On our request, the hotel gave us a better and bigger room within the same tariff on the next day. The food was average at best. The breakfast had a large menu but a few more vegetarian items would have made it even better. Given the size and number of rooms the breakfast lobby often was small and crowded. Overall, we had a great stay and we will stay there again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel from my point of view room small but comfort and clean”
Reviews.Author: ismail47
Reviews.Content: i arrived early ad 10 am on 17 aug. at recieption and they gave me the room after 15 min with complementary juice , guest relation coordinator as I REMEBRE HER NAME mrs serpi gave me all adresses for important palaces and place of interest so i could go easy with GPS ; THIS HOTEL is best in istanbul .location is 7 min from taxim square

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: helenbaggaley
Reviews.Content: Elite World Hotel is very close to the central area of Taksim - in the new part of Istanbul. The location is great. With local convenience stores all along the street and restaurants offering a variety of cuisines. We stayed during Ramadan and the hotel were well equipped to cater for both muslim and non muslim guests. The service from the catering/waiters was excellent, very friendly and accomodating. The door staff were also very friendly, as were most of the front of house staff - who made excellent suggestions for us to experience, including a boat trip at night along the Bosphorus which included dinner as well as traditional Turkish entertainment, and a fantastic fish restaurant 'Istanbul Balik Restaurant' underneath the Galata Bridge (beautiful views and excellent service). Although we did have one case in which the service was below par - one member of staff dealing with an issue regarding our booked transport to the airport was less than helpful and rudely began checking in other guests in the middle of our enquiry - basically ignoring our request, without apologising or letting us know that she wasn't dealing with it. However once we made a complaint about this service the Guest Relations Manager sorted out our request and was very apologetic about her staff's behaviour. The rooms were clean and serviced every day, and the housekeeping staff were flexible in the times they were able to access the room (as we had late nights due to Ramadan, we were up later than most other guests, so the housekeeping staff would happily do our rooms once we had left.) Every room has a jacuzzi bath which after a long day of exploring the many sites Istanbul has to offer, is an excellent way to unwind! The swimming pool was nice, although you are asked to wear a swimming cap for hygiene reasons. I didn't personally use the gym or massage facilities, but other guests were impressed with both. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay, an excellent, comfortable and friendly base from which to stay and experience Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Staying again!”
Reviews.Author: Capri-san
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Turkey with my family. Everything was first experience in Turkey. This hotel was very nice in location, price, and services. Especially, breakfast was fantastic! We'll be back to this hotel again when visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CetK
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon in this hotel on April 2010. I think it is one of the best hotels in Taksim. Its location is perfect; less than 10 minutes walk to Istklal Street. Rooms are well equipped, clean, modern and very romantic Taking into consideration that rooms are not vast but this is the case for all other hotels in Taksim I loved staying there any I wish Iâ€™ll be back one day

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: GregoryMeg
Reviews.Content: We were two couples with 8 year old kids from Cyprus and stayed for 5 days in this beautiful hotel. Looking back I can not pin-point one single negative point to write for this hotel. In simple words: Very hospitable staff, with good knowledge of the english language, excellent breakfast (subereg was great), room(s) on the sixth floor were `good` size, very clean, bathroom was excellent, view was great, lobby was excellent, porters were helpful, position of the hotel was excellent.........what else should I mention. I`ve been telling all my greek friends to stay there once they travel to Istabul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I was traveling a group around the world for a television commercial and one of our stops where we were going to film was Istanbul. I arrived in Istanbul one day ahead of the group and discovered---to my dismay---that the hotel we had been booked in was in an absolutely dull part of Istanbul---devoid of life...and the town was full up due to congresses and conventions. Undaunted---I headed to the Taksim Square at 6AM to find another hotel despite my travel agents message that "everything in Istanbul that we'd like was sold out"---and---to my wonderful luck some rooms had opened up at the Elite World Hotel, which is only about two blocks from Taksim Square and right in the area where night life, cafes, etc. begin. We stayed at the Elite World Hotel and had a fantastic stay---the rooms were wonderful (my was recently redone) and the location was fantastic, and I would absolutely stay there again. And while the breakfast buffet was good, the only demerit I can post about the Elite World was that the food is not great. Not horrible by any means---but not great---but there are so many other great places to go/eat nearby that this shouldn't stop you from staying there. Just one note: don't confuse this with the Elite World Prestige Hotel (at Sehit Muhtar Caddesi. No 40----whereas the Elite World Hotel is Sehit Muhtar Caddesi No 42!!!) which is directly next door and a sister hotel---the Elite World Hotel bills itself as a 5 star---which the Elite World Prestige next door (and apparently owned by the same company) is a 3 star hotel with very mediocre rooms---but the hotel names are so confusing it would be easy to confuse. So be careful as the hotels are completely different in quality.

Reviews.Title: “We found the Elite an excellent choice for Istanbul visiting”
Reviews.Author: ckljpl
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the modern, clean and very five star hotel - The reception personnel were extremely welcoming - attentive and helpful to our stay... Excellent buffet breakfast - wide selection of good foods and fruits - Housekeeping was first class!!! Complete fitness and spa area - Would definitely stay again - Carol and Joe L. Baltimore Md USA

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back:-)”
Reviews.Author: JANANIZAR
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife visited turkey isnatnbul and stayed for this 2nd time at this great hotel, the staff were all very helpfull and Courteous, their rooms are very tidy and clean, the breakfast buffet is varied and delicious. We would like to especially point out and thank one the excellent staff who helped us greatly in an ordeal we faced, she is Mrs. Serpil Temizer at the guest relations. Our great appreciation goes to the management of this hotel and her personally. Thanks & Best Regards - Nizar Alterkait - Kuwait City - Kuwait.

Reviews.Title: “A long way to go”
Reviews.Author: TedMeades
Reviews.Content: First impressions were not bad. The lobby had a pleasing appearance, check in was completed politely and quickly and the luggage handling service was also good. However, the negatives aspects of the hotel began to emerge as soon as we got to the room. This was far smaller than expected, with two single beds, a tiny desk and only one armchair shoehorned into a corridor-like space. The wardrobe and storage areas were not particularly generous either â€“ adequate for a single person staying a few nights but not a couple staying a week. Then there was the awful view from the window â€“ this was onto the roof top of the adjacent hotel just a few feet away, complete with satellite dishes and huge extractor fans. This really was quite appalling for a supposedly â€œdeluxeâ€� room. On the positive side, the furniture and fixtures were new and in good nick. There were many other disappointments, but Iâ€™ll mention just three: The entire hotel is serviced by only three lifts, which meant that at busy times the journey from the room to the lobby took all of ten minutes! Breakfast was a grim experience. There were far too many tables packed into a small space, which made moving from the table to the buffet bar something of an obstacle course going on dodgem rink. The food was really nothing special and frankly far below a quality youâ€™d expect at a five-star hotel. On one morning we found the milk had curdled and set solid in the jug! So while there are some good things to say about this hotel there is also much here that leaves a lot to be desired. It is certainly not the worst hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in, but at over 200 Euros a night I would have to say it is very poor value for money â€“ hence the two stars.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: fabs58
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Room rate was good compared to the standards and services offered. Very good breakfast too (although hotel staff seemed to be always in a rush). My room was on the top floor. It was clean and nicely decorated - although a bit small. It also offered a great view on the city. unfortunately I forgot my laptop charger at the hotel and was told that it was not possible to have it back... as it was somehow gone lost. anyway, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome locantion, thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: cimikiy
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was ur first stop in Turkey and this hotel couldnÂ´t be better, the staff is great, the food is awesome and is near to everything, like 5 min to the Taksin Park. The apple pie is a must have! And the reception at the bar is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: greyhound15
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we felt right away very welcome. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. The customer relations manager, Serpil Temizer, was of tremdous help recommending sites, things to do and bars / restaurants. She also took care of our dinner reservations. The room (regular size) and bathroom were very clean and offered everything one would expect at this type of hotel. The fitness and spa area is outstanding. Steam Bath, Sauna, Hammam, Calming Rooms, Pool and Excercise Room were all very clean, functional and in excellent condition. Forget the public Hammams and take advantage of what the hotel is offering.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the middle of Ä°stanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Rawat_sha
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when reading the previous negative reviews as we had an amazing week at Elite World Hotel. You canâ€™t just say, this is a horrible hotel because AC is not working or receptionist was rude??? I was there! AC is working properly, reception staff is so nice and helpful or luggage handling guys are very hardworking. How come people just say that the hotel is not nice?? Yes, rooms are a little small but I need good service and smiling faces before the size of the room. The staff was very friendly and their knowledge and advice were very helpful. Especially Serpil, the guest relation lady made us feel very welcome and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for celebrating anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Dzhukelova
Reviews.Content: The service was good, especially the attitude of the guest relation coordinator - Serpil Temizer- many thanks to her:). She was very helpful and did her best to make our stay awesome. The staff spoke very good english. The room was nice, although not very big for a five star quality. I think they could clean it better anyway- there was dust on the drawers. The location of the hotel is the best part of it. Very close to all the sightseeings in the new European part, and there is merto and bus stops quite near. The breakfast was really nice- a lot of choices to make. And it was delicious. Anyway the thing that almost ruin our stay there was the girl in the Spa reseption area- i think the management should pay more attention to the attitude of that staff with guests. I made reseravtion for a massage( I really wanted to use the Spa of the hotel ) and paid for it- but when I went for it in the evening, that same girl told me I could not have my massage, because there was no time left for me!!!!!!!!! Unbelievable!!!!!!!! Shame for the prestige of the hotel!!!!!!! And I was so hurry to come back from our sightseeings day in time for my massage- and then....not to have it. The manager should pay attention to that kind of service!!!!!! Anyway- I liked my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Elite World, Istanbul - @ Heart of the city gets it to your heart !”
Reviews.Author: satyamjuneja
Reviews.Content: I stayed for over 2 weeks at Elite World Hotel in Istanbul. The service @ Elite world was simply awesome and world class. Its double suites have all modern facilities at par with any decent 5-star hotel in Turkey. Its located at the centre of Taksim, a very plush and happening locality in Istanbul, which is one of the most happening places. The hotel has all 5-star facilities including a spa, underground pool and a fitness club. And for the reasonable price it comes, these facilities are rare to find in other good hotels.The "high" factor was its guest relation, customised service. The "low" would be the heavy rush at the hotel due to its central location. Food rates at 3.5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Elite World is a perfect hotel for me to stay for whatever purpose!”
Reviews.Author: MansourDubai
Reviews.Content: My review to Elite World Hotel is excellent. However this is just an advice to other tourists who want nightlife. I would just want to â€˜adviceâ€™ or â€˜warnâ€™ to all men with the plans going to nightclubs. Please be careful if you are invited by some men (who are the managers of a nightclub very close to the hotel)â€¦I wouldnâ€™t want to mention the name of the nightclub but it is 3 or 4 blocks on the left when you get out of the hotel entrance. The name of the club sounds an â€œAsian countryâ€�â€¦ I am saying this because my friend and myself have been overcharged (or cheated so to speak) paying more than USD 1500 for two girls sitting with us for about a couple of hours?? Their trick goes this way----- they will invite you and offer you with girls. They will tell your drink is TL 10 only but they wouldnâ€™t tell you that the time of the girls are for every 10 minutes you will be charged by TL 80â€¦and they will charge you with more than number of glasses the girls have actually consumed.. You will just be shocked when you receive your bill! ..and they will trick you to offer discount and at the end still it is very high. So be careful guys! I would suggest you ask the advice of the reception which nightclub to go. The hotel might have one or some recommendations. I am saying this because I wouldnâ€™t want other men tourists to end up with experiences just like what happened to us. Of course men like us wanted to go nightclubbing to have fun especially in beautiful city of Istanbul. And these people shouldnâ€™t take advantage of that and that destroys the image of the Turkish rich and impressive culture. Please do not be tricked by the managers of the girls. You might be charged so much when they offer you a girl to sit on your table. So be careful!. You might consider bringing someone whom you know well or who will not cheat you. I would recommend the VERSAI nightclub in Ortakoy â€“ it is fantastic, trendy, they have good staff legit to deal with and real fun over there. We really did enjoy in VERSAI club! But I think you should be couple. Nevertheless, Elite Hotel is real perfect. My friend has selected it actually and we had fabulous stay on this hotel with nice and professional staff. Turkish way! They have complete and excellent facilities â€“ i.e. sauna, gym, Turkish bath and massage rooms. They have fast internet connections. I would definitely highly recommend this hotel to other tourists or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,warm and made us feel very special”
Reviews.Author: istanbul63
Reviews.Content: The staff where extremely friendly, hospitable and made every effort to make our stay perfect. The gym and leisure facilities where clean with knowledgeable trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED STAYÄ°NG HERE....”
Reviews.Author: soliana_11
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the ELÄ°TE WORLD HOTEL Ä°STANBUL.It was our first visit to Istanbul (a great city), we were lucky to stay at ELÄ°TE WORDL HOTEL. nice hotel, nice location & nice staff. We had 3 rooms at the 11th. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “high quality of service”
Reviews.Author: sunny_an
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, worthy of being chosen. There is good facilities (ie.business center 7/24, gym, swimming pool, spa, high speed wifi throughout......etc) and warmly service. Location is good, city shopping center is just nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Big expectations, big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: nikotka
Reviews.Content: This is really not a five star hotel. After my arrival I had to carry all my luggage to front desk, the porters were just looking at me and nobody helped. The level of english is poor, they can speak only at front desk. For example, I ordered a room service, grilled meat platter with ketchup and they brought me after one hour of waiting only ketchup. They knock at the door even if the light no disturbing is on. Room was really small, not enough space for the things. Housekeeping on a low level, they allways left the dirty dishes without changing, if you did not put them on a visible place and sometimes I had to wait up to three hours until somebody came. Bathroom is really small as well and also my door from the shower was broken so after showering I had small swimming pool on a floor. After departure and payment of all bills they charged me more, without explanation. Internet is really slow in the rooms, but for free.I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “small minus”
Reviews.Author: zvonchica
Reviews.Content: very beautiful hotel, but unsatisfying level of english knowledge! difficulties during the basic communication with employees!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels for corporate travel in Europe,bÄ±g,frÄ±endly staff,clean room..”
Reviews.Author: besttravel48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good condition and the amenities and bedrooms are truly excellent.staff was very frÄ±endly,heplful.the atmosphore is ok.room was wiht balcony at 8thfloor.and very clean room.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, top quality hotel in a great location,big and very clean room.”
Reviews.Author: holday101turkey
Reviews.Content: An excellent, top quality hotel in a great location,big and very clean room. The hotel is very green/ environ friendly, almost too much.bigroom,very clean.classÄ±c lobby,staff very professÄ±onal.....

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel for our company's annual gathering so I sum up by counting positives and negatives: GOOD: 1. The hotel is nicely decorated and you can see beautiful designs around the lobby. 2. The location is the best in Istanbul 3. Staff are polite and try to be nice to guests NOT SO GOOD: 1. Sleep quality at my room was a disaster since every 5 minutes a frightening BUMP sound could be heard from the corridor and originally from the adjacent building ! 2. When all of our team checked in to our rooms we felt that we are inside a big refrigerator. the rooms were all much much colder than the weather outside !! ( keeping in mind that we were on the last week of November) one by one we brought the matter to the reception and complained about the condition of our rooms but we heard 1001 excuses ( some were really funny ! ) and zero effort to solve the issue and turning the heating system on.So we experienced Ice Age sleep quality during our stay.... bottom line : 6 out of 10 returned home sick one of them directly taken to hospital from the airport! 3. Some the dishes at breakfast were not washed properly and had traces of food on the surface. 4. The wireless internet was buggy most of the times as the signal in my room become so week. I think they should fortify the signal at the end of the corridors. All in all ,will not recommend & will definitely NOT going back there

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Tertinaz
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this beautiful hotel which we had our wedding last year at the same day. They gave us the same room as they did before which is a suite . The room was perfect two lcd tv's and also jakuzi with seperate shower in the same bath room. Room is very spacious and we were on the 10th floor. we had a breath taking view of Istanbul. They arranged everything for us and everything was beautiful. We take the massage service it was very relaxing and I recommend it strongly. Thanks for everything and thank you for making our anniversary for a memorable stay Ms. Ahu Ozer.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: maha123
Reviews.Content: They say it's a 5 star hotel..but with me traveling all around the world and stay at 5 star hotels always.i can say with full honesty i WONT even give this hotel a 3 star..1st ;from the very 1st moment they have no bell man to get the luggages,then from that point,everything is down hill...the front dest service was an awfull experience;they are so very rude,the girl who's been handling my reservation cant even give a smile.anyway..i got the room and it's the smallest i have ever seen..i cant even hang my clothes because it's too tiny.i ask for extra towel they hang up in my face,finaly before the last day i ask to talk to the manager ,i got that chance after a long wait;he was nice and was writing everything i said but at the end his staff did not respond well..when i left the hotel now the bell man ran and put all the luggages in his so called friend's taxi that belong to the hotel;the driver took me from a very long way to the airport that i never been to before ,i been traveling to Istanbul for such i long time for many years..so i know my way very well and usualy it cost me from airport to taxim not more than 50 turkish lira and this time it was a 110 lira when i handle the driver the two 50 lira bills in a second he changed them into a two 5 lira bills and insist that i did not give him two 50's..then i realize that hotel bell man and the girl at the front desk who was so very mean with me had a plan with the driver against me..so plz if you want to travel to Istanbul,DONT ever choose this terrible hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: eguene1
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Elite World Hotel, Istanbul. Besides its unbeatable location,just a few steps to Taxim Square,Galata Tower and 10 minutes to the old town! The hotel has a very welcomed homy feelings, thanks to its guest relation manager Serpil and all the staff, that did whatever it took to make our staying memorable one. The room was great, meaning spacious, clean, well appointed, and so was the bathroom.The food was great thanks to the kitchen staff. I could write more about this 5 star hotel, but I think I got my message across. All things considered I would go back there without any hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Elite service at elite world”
Reviews.Author: Nadinezant
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul for three days and I styed at very cheap in service hotel which made me leave Istanbul to other cities for the rest of the 10 days , then when I came back to istanbul as my return will be from Istanbul airport , I styed at elite world hotel in taksim , I gain faith again in Istanbul hotels, I like the service , the proffesionalisim , the smily warm faces. I got nice treat from Ms Amanda , I liked her friendly attitude and smile. Definitly I will come back her to Istanbul to elite world only. Well done team.

Reviews.Title: “I have traveled to Istanbul several times,”
Reviews.Author: facebook27
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Istanbul several times, staying at Kempinski (Ciragan), the Hilton Macka and the Marmara Taksim. This stay at the ELÄ°TE world hotel Ä°stanbul was a sheer delight. The rooms were clean,staff was excellent,thank you for ewerthÄ±ng.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: samhark
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Istanbul, I booked the hotel stay through a travel agent I know, he'd recommended it to me. I stayed in this hotel for 4 night, when I arrived from the airport, at the hotel entrance there were two gentlemen from the staff chatting and didn't pay attention to me trying to drag my bags, it took them a little bit to see me approaching and help me out with the bags. At the reception, the staff were very friendly and the check-in process was very smooth. I booked a standard room, it was small but very clean, everything was there including free Wi-fi, and I was lucky to get my room on the 8th floor which is the only floor that had a balcony overseeing the city, it was a very nice view. When I got into the bathroom, there were no towels, no slippers, no bath robes so I called the room service but they brought only towels! On the next day I informed the front desk staff and he sorted it out. Mattress was a bit hard but comfortable. Breakfast was good and the menu had a variety of dishes, and the staff were helpful and very friendly. I booked all my tours through concierge and found no problems at all, again the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly which is something noteworthy. I used the swimming pool, it was located on the floor -4 and everything was organized and clean. On my third day, I dropped some juice on the bed, I called the room service and they were prompt at coming and changing the bed sheets. Overall, this is a very good hotel, it's clean, new and has a warm atmosphere, staff are very friendly and speak English fluently, food is very good, and most importantly the location was great, the hotel is surrounded by mini-markets, restaurants, cafÃ©s and bars, and it's very close to Taksim square and Istiklal Avenue, less than 10 minutes walk, I use to go there every day, Also it's few minutes away from the metro station and taxi location if you want to go to Sultanahmet area. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and have to say that it was quite unremarkable as a hotel. The service was poor at best with sullan and unhelpfull staff. Avoid using the minibar and go to the mini supermarket on the corner of the road (1 minute away) and get all your comforts, waters etc. as you will be gauged if you use the minibar. The only positive for this hotel is the location, far enough from Taksim square to not have the noise but close enough to make it a walkable distance. I noticed the rack rates on display where â‚¬450 per night!!!! if I had paid that much per night for my stay I would now be crying... I was told all the rooms came with a queen bed and a single bed. Although I have ticked that I would not recommend this hotel to a friend if I got a really good price I would stay here again, knowing that I could not expect a good level of service. It would be based on price and location only.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not "Five Stars."”
Reviews.Author: cpcanadaVancouver
Reviews.Content: On the way to town, my transfer driver asked where I was staying. He said: "That's a five star hotel but it is not a five star hotel." I asked him where I should eat: "Not at the hotel." His review was spot on. On the surface, this place is nice: a pool, marble everywhere, etc. But it doesn't hold up once you are in the room. Non-smoking rooms that stink of smoke. I asked to move. A shower with no door, so the place gets soaked in a shower. Mold on the caulking. No coffee maker, just one towel, beds hard as rocks and an air conditioner that made sleeping difficult with its howling. The service was grudgingly friendly, as if my requests, as a customer in a "deluxe room" paying 200 dollars/night didn't rate alongside those of the clearly wealthy businessmen and families making demands. And the food was mediocre. A 15 euro breakfast got you a boring buffet the same as every other hotel buffet in Turkey. Though the "western" coffee was decent. Further, the milk you for every cent: 200/night does not get free printing in the "business centre" (which include a couple computers and a printer and a fax machine) but instead you pay 95 euro cents per page! The wireless is of intermittent quality in the rooms, occasionally dropping out, which is frustrating on a conference VOIP call. As for cleanliness: my room was clean, except for the mildew and so on, and except for the opened box of milk that had been in the mini-bar for a long, long time. I opened the door and the blast of sour milk smell was charming. My friend was around the corner in the Nippon at 95 euros/night. Brighter, more comfy in many ways, and utterly friendly service. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5-star and same problem with taxi cheat”
Reviews.Author: pdv999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six nights (conference). I would not stay here again. The location is OK and the (important) the mattress is comfortable but this hotel just can not be considered a 5-star hotel. A few simple examples: very small room, mini-bathroom, no coffee maker, no newspaper, very few international TV channels (e.g. only one Turkish channel to watch the 2010 World Cup), no fresh orange juice at breakfast buffet (you can order for 5 lira (!!!))..... There is a mini-bar in the room but contents are prohibitively expensive. The wifi was working fine in my room and daily cleaning of the room was done well. My worst experience however was similar to what another reviewer metioned: taking a taxi back to the airport. I asked the reception about the costs for a taxi to the airport and was told 50 lira. I was told it was 50 TL. This was also the amount I paid when I arrived from the airport to the hotel with a metered taxi. I took one of the taxis in front of the hotel and asked the price. The taxi driver said "meter-taxi" which was fine with me as I expected it would come to 50 TL. He took the same road I took the first time from the airport to the hotel but when I arrived at the airport the meter it was almost 70 TL. Clearly, I was cheated by this taxi driver - so don't trust these guys and agree on a price beforehand. It is easy to manipulate a taxi meter. The guy who cheated me is driving a yellow Renault Megane with a red sticker on the back windscreen with the name of the Elite World Hotel and their website so they're closely connected. Twice I have sent the hotel an email about this, asking for their feedback, but no reply. So it seems they don't really care about their customers - another example why this is definitely not a 5-star hotel! There are much better deals to be had in Istanbul: either spend the same and stay at a real 5 star or spend half and stay in a hotel with similar quality of the Elite World.

Reviews.Title: “great location, small but good and clean rooms, nice spa, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelqueen
Reviews.Content: We were invited to a wedding in Istanbul. All recommended hotels had been booked out (bank holiday weekend) so I started to check for hotels near taksim square on tripadvisor. The recommendations for Elite were everything from excellent to never again. I booked and asked upfront for a room on a higher level and pickup service via email. The response was quick â€“ hotel pick up is 35 euro. Driver Ali (who is super nice!!!) picked us up on time and we even got a little sightseeing tour and tons of shopping recommendations on the way to the hotel. We got a room on the 8th floor. The room was small â€“ yes â€“ but nothing compare to tiny in NY or London. It was clean, the bathroom was tiny but well designed (Jacuzzi, loudspeakers, everything you expect). The view was phenomenal and it was quiet. Free WiFi made my live easier as â€œHeâ€� was happy he got excess. The spa is wonderful. The pool is small (hey, you are in the middle of a pulsing city â€“ if you want a spa spa go to the country side!) but beautifully designed â€“ 3 different saunas â€“ and everything was clean. It is annoying really that they make you buy a cap for 1,50 Euro for swimming and it was a bit difficult to communicate (sorry, I donâ€™t speak Turkish) but with slow articulate English it all worked. To wrap it all up: it is a clean and friendly hotel who really do a lot to make their guests happy. The location is top if you want be in the center of taksim. ask for a room on a higher floor - it is for sure quiet! Staff is friendly and if you try a little, they understand you! Would I go again â€“ no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMonroe97
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday morning and left our bags at the desk to do some sightseeing and arrived back around 5 PM. Wihing 10 minutes of getting into our room, we heard metal-against-metal from above and the "air conditioning" became a heating fan! We called the front desk and they sent the two stooges up to fix the unit. One actually climbed a ladder to look at the unit and the ladder tipped over! They claimed that it would take 30 minutes for the water to start working and we would have cool air again. Of course, nothing happened and we called the front desk. The "manager" claimed that he had spoken to them and they said we may need to wait another 30 minutes. We said that was unacceptable and wanted to get another room. The manager said "no, he woudl not do that". My husband then got on the line and told him that we were packing our bags and would be down in the lobby to get another room immediately. The manager then showed up five minutes later to our room and escorted us to another room, which was only slightly better with the cold air. From reading the other reviews, it is clear that this hotel does not have air conditioning that works and the staff simply lies to customers. We had to stay here for a business conference staying here after our weekend of sightseeing, but I wished now we had booked into the Hilton Istanbul and moved here only for business part of the trip. The staff did not display any friendliness and the manager dealing with the air conditioning was rather rude about initially refusing to change our rooms. Note that the second room we moved to had a very dangerous tub situation. The tub is quite high off the marble floor and there are no handles anywhere to grasp on to aftering showering. I do not recommend this hotel for anyone. One can do much better being closer to the sights and better accomadations. In a city as hot and humid as Instanbul, air conditoning is a must.

Reviews.Title: “We found this hotel clean and comfortable with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mick_and_Moose
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for a business meeting, and the Elite World (note - confusingly, there is another hotel of similar name, the Elite World Prestige hotel right next door!) was being used for this. Booking was made though an agency appointed by the meeting hosts, and there was a minor problem when we arrived to find the hotel expected us for only two nights, when I had reserved for four. However, this was all sorted out very courteously and without problem. Contrary to other reviewers' experience, everything in our room worked exactly as it should and we had a very comfortable stay. All staff, whether at breakfast or at the desk helping with ferry trip details, were extremely courteius and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but the pictures are not quite accurate”
Reviews.Author: mac0sta
Reviews.Content: All in all, the hotel was not bad. I organized an event at this hotel and the service was ok; the hotel is nice and clean, also the rooms are pretty but definitely very small, especially for a 5 star. The food wasn't what I'd call excellent, but it was OK. It is within walking distance of the Taksim square and other attractions are quite close, too. I used the spa, got a massage, went to the hairdresser, all available in the hotel but just as big enough to give you a quick getaway, but not to concentrate one's vacation on. Most meeting rooms have no windows because they're underground. The service is not really excellent, staff was always nice and helpful, but I found out recently that some very expensive materials we'd been looking for the past months hasn't gone lost as expected, but ended up being somewhere in the hotel and the staff never consigned it to our hauler. But all in all it was a positive experience, and I've received support where needed, so everything went smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't worth the 5 stars, NO value for the money in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khalidsawalha
Reviews.Content: I staid there for 6 nights during my business trip to Turkey, as a Five starts hotel close to the center and attractions! I have to say it was very bad stay. First impression when you arrive you will say WaW, then you get to your room ... the carpet is filthy, and it was like sauna ... I was burning out, I turned on the AC .. it was not working, so I went down and they informed me that it will not work till 6pm "this is the system" so I was sweating till 7 and it doesn't work (of course the windows don't open). and after hard talk with them they moved me next day to a room where I can open the windows, but it was for people with disability, therefore everything was designed for disabled people to feel comfortable, which means I felt handicapped in this room. Not to mention that the mattress protector was dirty with red and brown spots everywhere. Don't you agree that this is too much for 160 EUR per night!!!??

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here. This five star is a joke.....”
Reviews.Author: micheleeisabella
Reviews.Content: Come from Italy with another couple for the weekend. Checked in in rooms at 9th floor and in both rooms air conditioning not working. Changed room and the first is too small and very noisy (1421) and we found the other one DIRTY (1417). Jazz company playad music with a speaker left in the road at a loud level (I coud recognize every single song from my room while trying to fall asleep). Forget to stay here, this is not a 5 star hotel, 15 euros for breakfast without the possibility of drinking a proper expresso. Don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiraz42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my husband. Have travelled extensively and stayed in many 5 star hotels, this is not 5 star. We arrived very early in morning after travelling through the night and had requested an early check in. It was my birthday and we were also celebrating our anniversary, tough, we were made to wait until check in despite rooms being available. The staff need a lesson or two in how to treat guests. The reception staff never smile and are unhelpful. Concierge is a joke, what is that, it was only the young doorman that tried to help with directions ect. Food is absolutely awful as is room service and expensive, rooms small, TV package 40 euro a night, a movie 15 euro and they are old, left with the news channel. Spa is very good, pool,sauna ect. charge guests 3TL for a swimming cap to use the pool, come on Elite World. Too far from the sites if on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is wonderful; this hotel is a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Serene_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Four nights of hell. There was no airconditioning. Well in the lobby and the corridors there was. But the rooms? The room temperature was over 35. Repeated requests were met with "we will fix it". Then they offered us another room. It had an opening window, but no airconditioning. We asked that the blinds be left closed. They weren't. We felt like ants beneath a cruel child's magnifying glass. Other guests complained too. One poor man was almost in tears in the lift. There was NEVER a manager available (except when we checked out - a bit late), although one night we got to meet a manager who admitted that he was really only the gymnasium manager, and didn't know what to do. Twice we were told that the hotel system 'only heats'. Twice we were told that it 'would be fixed in three hours'. For over 300 euros a night! We had prepaid. THAT is why we didn't leave. The concierge didn't know where things were when we sought directions. And the fresh fruit was canned and the freshly squeezed juice at the dreadful breakfast a type of weak cordial. Management KNEW that there was a problem, but still happily took paying guests in, and put them in rooms in which you could not sleep. We have travelled extensively. This is the first time I have ever written a review.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicstyle24
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Istanbul. The location of this hotel couldn't been better, it's minutes away from Taksim Square at New town. The hotel service was great, this is a 5 star hotel and you pretty much get anything you want here from a turkish bath , nice clean pool and perfect service. The only thing I have to say is that we got a room next to a noisy street, but after a long tour day in Istanbul we manage to sleep it all. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: NisrineNiss
Reviews.Content: good hotel close to taksim square verry convenient to new visitors

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: furreyboots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and overall the experience was pretty good. The main negative for me was the breakfast (although there was as huge selection of Turkish food, as a European, there was nothing much on the breakfast menu for me. OK, it's good they have their own food available but perhaps some European choice would be nice too) and also the lack of air conditioning which doesn't seem to work on the thermostat control . As mentioned in other reviews, the bathroom was pretty small considering the size of the room itself. The floor I was on (8th) was noisy and you could quite easily hear people outside in the corridor talking late at night. I would suggest avoiding the rooms near the lifts. The rooms on the 8th floor are the only standard rooms which have balconies and was good for views over the city. The location of the hotel in Taksim was close to the traffic (which itself is chronic with traffic jams most of the time) and quite noisy so had to keep the balcony door closed most of the time and you can hear the calling to mosque ampified at 6 am every day. The rooms were very clean and high standard although the bed in the room was very hard. Lots of freebies, including a bottle of water every day in addition to the tea/coffee making stuff and things. Good gym and swimming pool facilities which are free for guests from 7-10 pm. The free wi-fi signal was poor-fair in my room but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service...........”
Reviews.Author: Travelleristanbul
Reviews.Content: I used to Stay in the Hotel.For 5 days.All was Ok Except Service.Hotel Service is not satisfied and you wil wait at least 10 minutes someone care of You Anywhere in the Hotel.And House Keeping Not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe The Best 5 Star Hotel in Taksim Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tertinaz
Reviews.Content: I made my wedding ceremony at Elite World Hotel in Taksim. And also stayed there for one night. The hotel is beautifull and have a good location it is in a walking distance to Taksim Square. I should have thanks to the Chef AydÄ±n who is very talent at cooking and serving. The service is very smooth and fast. Food and Breakfast is delicious. Rooms are big and spacious. I thank to all staff for making my wedding celebration a perfect and lovely night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: KnightsbridgeSaudi
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed in all of the 5 star hotels in Istanbul! This was by far the very best. Nice rooms great central location. Will be staying there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SaEl1
Reviews.Content: The hotel (in comparison with other hotels in the city) is great. The location is great also, the breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: eyre
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst service I've ever - I strongly suggest that you do not stay at this hotel. We arrived at the Elite World late at night - no assistance at the door so we had to drag our bags up a steep, slippery ramp on our own. At reception, we're told that all floors above ground have been flooded so we're can't stay at the Elite for our first night. This is patently untrue - besides the fact that a flood of this scale could not be fixed overnight, we can see other guests going upstairs normally/checking in. We find out later that this hotel frequently overbooks and that when this happens guests who have merely guaranteed their booking by card (as opposed to paying in advance) get "bumped". Reception completely ignored the fact that moving from place to place would be very difficult for us as we were travelling with a 6 month old baby, besides the fact that it would take a lot of time from what was already a short trip. When we went to look at the other residence offered, we found out that it was much further than the Elite had said (10 mins drive as opposed to 5 mins walk!), that the only rooms available were doubles (we had booked a triple) and there was no cot for the baby. When we raised this with the Elite, we were told this was the only option available - if we weren't happy with it, we'd have to find another hotel ourselves - given that it was now after midnight and we were three girls with a baby, this was clearly impossible. Thankfully, the staff at the alternative residence were incredibly helpful and with their help we managed to get things sorted out - no thanks to the Elite, who did not even bother to give us any compensation for the trouble and inconvenience they caused to us. In the circumstances, all I can say is do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best from other hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: sasito
Reviews.Content: i stayed in elite as honemooner and it was a nice hotel the rooms are small but clean with cute lighting the bathroom was maginificant th breakfast was very good i had a very nice stay in elite world and i recommend it to everyone need a nice hotel with good location

Reviews.Title: “Nice decorations no privacy in the rooms & it's a 4 star , there are better choices in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: indiana_johnes
Reviews.Content: Nice decorations no privacy in the rooms & it's a 4 star , there are better choices in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “crappy service”
Reviews.Author: indie_dive
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in very strategic location and the room was excellent. It has nice bathroom - separate shower & bath up (with jet). They have excellent sauna and Turkish bath. However, I was annoyed by their service, totally. First, they forgot to put towels, it's okay at the beginning - it could happen, I called room service and no one picked up the phone, then I called front office and asked to be assisted and he said he will ask his colleague to bring towels. I waited for almost 45 minutes and no one came to bring my towels while I had a meeting to attend. To cut the towel long story, finally I got them at around 10 pm. It was not a good impression on first day arrival. Secondly, I had to wear swimming hat in this hotel swimming pool and if you didn't have it, then you have to buy it from the hotel (this applied for men as well). Third, mineral water bottle next to the bed is not complimentary and this bottle was not included in their mini bar list. Personally the last one was perhaps my mistake for only viewing their mini bar bill list instead looking at the bottle carefully before drinking it. Last one, the front office staff were unfriendly, no smiles and very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks Totaly Sucks The Guest Relations Sucks !”
Reviews.Author: CrapMaster
Reviews.Content: ok So I Am Gonna Say It Loud And Clear....The Hotel Is Good Looking And Its Luxurious But The Service Sucks U See Most Of The Time There Isn't Any water in the hotel so u cant take a shower whenever u want and the breakfast is not that good its not bad but also not good ! And this is what they did to they charged us 50 euros extra....for a late check out...but we Didn't get it...and its not only us When u check in ur happy when u check out your sad cause every single person who checked out while i was staying had a fight with them some were charged for the Minibar when they didn't get it....some where in like my Position so in one sentence this hotel is not a good one and the rating should be 3 stars instead Of 5 ! thats it if u want my advice do not check in this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, small rooms, good location - not the best I've seen”
Reviews.Author: MauriceBakker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Taksim square, the heart of Istanbul. Shops, restaurants and bars are at walking distance. Also this hotel shouldn't be confused with its 4* sister hotel right next door. The spa and pool facilities in the basement are great, massages are available and worthwhile. The hotel is decorated in Ottoman style, with the former Sultan's signature visible in te bathroom screen. The rooms are very small (we even wonder if they are large enough for its 5* qualification) and that means that two people using one bathroom need to navigate and dance around one another to pass eachother. No rooms can be opened and the ventilation system is not up to speed in combination with that. Rooms tended to be a little bit hot. The service and friendliness of staff more than made up for this, on that aspect we have strongly opposing views to some reviewers. All in all, the hotel is a bit too expensve for its class and better can be found in istanbul. One should choose this hotel if found on special offer, the style and location are worthwhile.

HotelInfo.Name: Elite World Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sehit Muhtar Caddesi No 42 | Taksim, Istanbul 34435, Turkey
